author: Clibit@homebrewinguk.com

hops.name: Magnum
hops.notes: Very clean bittering hop, leaves almost no flavour used early in the boil. This is very handy for hop heavy beers with much use of late and dry hops

hops.name: Citra
hops.notes: Citra is a special aroma hop variety and has unique and highly favoured flavour characteristics. As the name suggests its flavour descriptors include the citrus fruits lime and grapefruit, other fruity characters described as gooseberry, passion fruit, lychee as well as numerous other tropical fruits. Best used for it’s aroma in late and dry additions. There is no other hop like it.

yeasts.name: Verdant IPA
yeasts.description: LalBrew® Verdant IPA was specially selected in collaboration with Verdant Brewing Co. (UK) for its ability to produce a variety of hop-forward and malty beers. Prominent notes of apricot and undertones of tropical fruit and citrus merge seamlessly with hop aromas.

source.name: 02 NL Spa Reine Flat Mineral Water (www.ah.nl)

total.name: 02 NL Spa Reine Flat Mineral Water (www.ah.nl)

sparge.name: 02 NL Spa Reine Flat Mineral Water (www.ah.nl)

mash.name: 02 NL Spa Reine Flat Mineral Water (www.ah.nl)

mashFermentables.name: Clear Choice Malt Extra Pale
mashFermentables.notes: Application:-Clear Choice Malt Extra Pale has a sweet honey flavour and is used in golden ales and lagers. Can be used as 80 –  100% of the Grist.

mashFermentables.name: Rye Malt
mashFermentables.notes: In brewing, when mixed with barley malt, rye malt can improve head retention, improve mouthfeel and introduce flavour changes of a toffee/caramel note at lower inclusion rates and a spicy after-palate at higher inclusion rates. Most notably, rye malt will also impart a reddish hue to beers.
Toasted Wheat Malt can add bready and nutty flavours to different types of beer. It will improve head retention and is used at up to 10% inclusion for Ales and 50% for wheat beers.
mashFermentables.name: Toasted Wheat Malt

mashFermentables.notes: Munich malts are produced on a conventional kiln and provide golden through to orange hues
mashFermentables.name: Dark Munich Malt

otherFermentables.name: Premium Grade Light Liquid Malt Extract

otherFermentables.notes:
Finest quality spray dried malt extract light.
To make a 1 litre yeast starter at 1.040 add 113 grams
Each 1 kg equals 1.035 starting gravity in 10 litres.
3.27 kg in 23 litres gives a starting gravity of 1.050, making an end product of approximately 5%
otherFermentables.name: Spray Dried Malt Extract - Light

name: Red IPA
notes:
Target: ABV = 5.5 %, IBU = 60?, EBC = 28. OG = 1.055, FG = 1.014.
Tweaked Beerworks Hopped LME from the kit  with NBS LME and Magnum bittering hops.
